level.heading: Filing and enforcement of custody decree of another state. [Repealed]
Legislative History of Laws
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 4-200, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 16-4501. Attorney fees. Subsection (d) does not require an explicit finding by the trial court that a party has violated an out-of-state custody order before it can award attorney's fees and expenses. Bliss v. Bliss, App. D.C., 733 A.2d 954 (1999).
For D.C. Law 13-293, see notes following § 16-4501.

level.heading: Uniform Law
level.text: This section is based upon § 15 of the Uniform Child Custody Jurisdiction Act. See Volume 9, Part IA Uniform Laws Annotated, Master Edition, or ULA Database on Westlaw.
